intro: Boechera holboellii, commonly known as the Sierra rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or yellowish flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. The plant has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
